publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-08-31 14:51:25 -0400.

repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Library

did.abstract: Papers of John J. Driscoll, labor leader in the Connecticut state AFL-CIO. Materials include photographs, framed certificates of appreciation, day books, published material (newspaper and magazine articles, labor literature), and scrapbooks. Also includes some legal papers created by Bridgeport, Connecticut, judge Margaret Connors Driscoll, John's wife.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

acqinfo.head: Provenance and Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by David Driscoll, John and Margaret Driscoll's son, in 2000. All of the materials were previously stored in the Driscolls' Bridgeport, Connecticut, home.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: John Joseph Driscoll was born in 1911 in Waterbury, Connecticut. The son of Irish immigrants, he graduated Phi Beta Kappa in Philosophy from Wesleyan University, from which he also received a masters degree in English and then earned another graduate degree in Philosophy from Brown University. He spent a year at Harvard Law School but left in 1937 to work for 40 cents an hour at the Bristol Company in Waterbury, where he waged a successful union-organizing campaign. He was soon appointed to a full-time position with the International Union of Mine, Mill and Smelter Workers. He soon moved on to the Congress of Industrial Organizations (CIO), the United Auto Workers and the newly merged AFL-CIO.

Mr. Driscoll became executive secretary of the Connecticut State Labor Council in 1957 and was elected president in 1961, a position he held until his retirement in 1985. During that time he worked for the rights of public employees to unionize, served on the Governor's Council of Economic Advisors and on the state's first Commission for Higher Education. He was a delegate to five Democratic National Conventions.
Mr. Driscoll was married to Margaret Connors and had a son, David. He lived in Bridgeport when he died on July 21, 1994, at the age of 82.

Margaret Connors Driscoll was born in Bridgeport, Connecticut, likely in 1915, and graduated in 1935 from Wellesley College. She received her law degree from Yale Law School in 1938, one of five women in the class.

Mrs. Driscoll was heavily involved in Democratic politics and labor issues before her appointment as a judge to the Connecticut Juvenile Court in 1960. She served as chief judge -- the first woman to do so -- from 1976 to 1978. She was a judge of the Connecticut Superior Court from 1978 to 1985.
Mrs. Driscoll died on May 15, 2000, in Fairfield, Connecticut, at the age of 85.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Many of the Papers of John Driscoll include files from Margaret Connors Driscoll's career. The Papers consist of correspondence, newspaper clippings, fliers, notes, publications, administrative records, photographs on topics including labor studies and education, unfair labor practices, worker's compensation, CIO annual convention, unemployment compensation, various companies contract negotiations, disabilities insurance, special sessions of General Assembly, the legislative session, mine and mill damage suits, Associations of Catholic Trade Unionists, farm workers, the Workmen's Compensation Act, the Connecticut Conference on Social and Labor Legislation, Award: John Driscoll elected to represent Waterbury Brass Workers Union No. 251, International Union of Mine, Mill and Smelters Workers Executive Board Minutes 1939, Nonferrous Metals Industry Unionism, 1958 Legislature Unemployment Compensation, Present Economic Trends in Connecticut 1958, United Auto Workers (UAW), Legislation in CIO, Legislative Reports and Bulletins, Margaret Driscoll becomes Connecticut's First Female Judge, Various Court Cases Margaret Driscoll as Attorney,

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Copyright Information
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from the owner(s) of the copyright.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, Newspaper Clippings, Transcripts, Manuscripts, Fliers, Notes, Publications, Administrative Records [Subjects include: Abolishment of Wage Differentials Based on Sex, Derby Gas and Electrical, Local 404, Pleadings, Labor Agreements.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper Clippings, Photographs, Correspondence, Notes, Administrative and Financial Records [Subjects include: Labor Studies and Education, Unfair Labor Practices, Worker's Compensation.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Illustrations, Notes, Publications, Correspondence, Newspaper Clippings, Fliers, Administrative Records [Subjects include: Labor Proposals, Labor Relations.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notes, Newspaper Clippings, Correspondence, Publications, Administrative and Financial Records [Subjects include: CIO Annual Convention, Unemployment Compensation, Torrington Company Contract Negotiations, Disabilities Insurance, Special Session of General Assembly, Legislative Session.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notes, Publications, Newspaper Clippings, Correspondence, Administrative and Financial Records [Subjects include: Mine-Mill damage suits, Ansonia Brass Workers, Domestic Campaign issues, Associations of Catholic Trade Unionists, Appointment as Judge, Farm Workers, Admission to the Supreme Court of the U.S., Women's conference on Legislative issues, Workmen's Compensation Act.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notes, Publications, Newspaper Clippings, Correspondence, Administrative Records [Subjects include: Worker's Defense League, International Mine, Mill and Smelter Workers vs. American Brass, Workmen's Compensation Draft Bill.]

did.unittitle: Correspondence, Publications, Photographs, Fliers (pamphlets), Clippings, Notes, Administrative Records,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Subjects Include: Local 251-International Union of Mine, Mill and Smelter Workers, Constitution of Local 251, Laborer's Non-Partisan League, Wagner Act, UAW Pension Information, Union Correspondence, Representative of Union Card and Membership Card, Weekly Reports of the Union 1941 by John J. Driscoll, 55th and 56th Annual Convention of the Connecticut Federation of Labor Official Proceedings, Statement by John J. Driscoll President of Connecticut AFL-CIO before the Economic Summit, UAW Memorial Tribute to John J. Driscoll. AFL-CIO: News, Reports, and Union. Margaret Driscoll: News, Articles, and Correspondence

did.unittitle: Administrative Records, Correspondence, Legal Documents, Financial Records, Photographs, Notes,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Subjects Include: Correspondence for Various Court Cases for Margaret Driscoll, Workers Compensation Cases against companies such as: Manufacturers Foundry Company, Seymour Manufacturing Company, American Brass Company, Scovill Manufacturing Company and New Haven Copper. Court Cases also include divorce cases and immigration cases. Connecticut State CIO 1952 Official Yearbook, Notebooks of Schedules.

did.unittitle: Administrative Records, Correspondence, Publications, Clippings, Reproductions of Clippings, Financial Records, Photographs, Fliers (Handouts, Pamphlets), Poster,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Subjects Include: AFL-CIO correspondence, amendments, minutes and conventions. Labor Notes and Votes Newsletter, Constitution of the Connecticut State Labor Council AFL-CIO, 1959. Various awards, memberships and recognitions for John Driscoll. Various 1960's photographs and clippings regarding, strikes, unions, and workers in Connecticut. Professor Robert Asher on Employment Lecture, Radio and Machine Workers of America, Agreement between Westinghouse Electric Corp. and United Electrical, John Driscoll AFL-CIO Election, 1968 Democratic National Convention, The Red Branch Cycle in English Literature, Brochures and Manuals for 1960's Appliances, Checkbooks.

did.unittitle: Administrative Records, Publications, Clippings, Correspondence, Relia, Photographs, Legal Documents, Fliers (Pamphlets, Handouts),

scopecontent.p: Subjects Include: Social Action Bulletin, 1970 UAW Proceedings, Binder containing information about the economy that could relate to the AFL-CIO, 1954 and 1955 Connecticut CIO Yearbooks, Authorization forms to Prosecute Wages and Hours, Full Employment Conference, Notebook Agendas, Bishop McAuliffe Memorial Award, By-Laws and Constitutions, Commentary: The Irish Of New York, Union Membership Books, AFL-CIO Newspapers, Connecticut: The Labor Situation, CIO State Council Releases, UAW Administrative Letters, Unemployment Compensation Information, Unemployment Compensation Information, California Unemployment Insurance Act, The Struggle For A Connecticut Steel Mill. Workers Compensation Cases against companies such as: Manufacturers Foundry Company, American Brass Company, Bridgeport Rolling Mills, Mattatuck Manufacturing Company.

did.unittitle: Photographs, Awards, Clippings, Fliers (Handouts), Correspondence, Publication,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Subjects Include: Photographs (President John F. Kennedy speaking to AFL-CIO leaders, John Driscoll protesting and at work, John Driscoll and Robert A. Petronella). Awards (Member of the Council of Economic Advisors, Diocesan Labor Institute McAuliffe Medal, Recognition for Service in Israel Histadrut Campaign). John Driscoll Retirement, Article on Conglomerate Unions, Re-elect Local Union Officers Flier, Bibliography on Irish and Civil War.

Publications of Economic Outlook, Congressional Record Vol. 96 No. 134. Relia: 20th UAW Convention Pin.
